should the dixie chics suffer from what they said about bush?
No. They are encouraging and fulfilling democracy.

I would say so. They played to their audience and spoke on something they are most likely not even informed about. 
 
 People don't want to hear them...they have the freedom to say it, but we have the freedom to buy whatever music we want.
So if you're dentist didn't agree with you on something you would stop seeing him? Sounds a little shallow and childish to me.

I think they shoulda kept their mouths shut, or realize the consenqeunces of what they say. Yes they have the right and freedom to say and feel how they want, but we have the freedom to not buy their stuff. My wife is going to go see them in July, that doesnt make my wife believe their pollitical views, she just, for some reason, likes their music.
dixie chics have cool music man. don't diss their music. anyway that's not what we're talking about. i think the only reason they're getting everyone mad is because they're famous.
If they want to alienate their core audience, they can
I sort of need a dentist... I don't need music. The situations are different.

Oh I see, this is all about you. For some reason I thought this was about standing up for what you believed and all that XXXX.
 
 So a correction is in order. Stand up for what you believe in, as long as it's convenient.

Stop trying to put words in his mouth, thistown.
 
 Any ways I hate the DIXIE CHIKS AND CHUNKS for what they said.... its their right though, but let me tell ya somethin they aint gettin any of my omoney or my families. My aunt is a huge country music fan, she used to love them now, she got rid of all their cds and never bying another one again.

I didnt like them much before, now I dont think I ever will. If that is how they feel they have the right to express themselves, but consumers also have the right to boycott thier products if they wish and for whatever reason they wish, I live in Shreveport which is where they bulldozed their CD's, I did not own any of their CD's and did not intend to buy any so I don't think they are going to be affected by myself boycotting their products. This is freedom of speech and choice in action, this is what democracy is for, when someone voices their opinion, others have the right to disagree or agree, in this case most people seemed to disagree, and if they disagree strongly enough, they can, if they wish, boycott their goods. There is no reason to praise the Dixie Chicks for excersing thier right to free speech and then tell people that they are childish for excersing their rights to boycott their products.
yeah but there's no reason to get mad at them for what they did either

No I agree that I can't tell people what to or what not to buy. But I can tell you how shallow and childish it is. 
 
 You don't like or support them (excluding those who already didn't like them, such as myself) simply because they disagree with you? That's straight out of pre-school. Horrible way to go through life. It's an 8 year old's mentality.
 
 And yes Broker, "God Bless America", home of the ignorant and the apathetic. You have all proved a very valuable point for me.
 
 Your idea of being proactive is not buying a Dixie Chicks cd?

Originally posted by Broker 
 
 I would say so. They played to their audience and spoke on something they are most likely not even informed about. 
 
 How do you know that they're misinformed? Did you meet them? Did you debate them? I doubt it. You are only assuming. They wouldn't say what they said without knowing what is happening. They were not born yesterday. I am sure they are very informed and can back their words.
 
 People don't want to hear them...they have the freedom to say it, but we have the freedom to buy whatever music we want.
 
 I'll give you this at least.

And what better reason to dislike someone becuase of what they believe in, that is who they are, would you rather me not like them becuase of the race, religion or nationality? I do disagree with what they said, if I were a fan before hand I would not buy their CD's as I do not want to support people with agendas counter to mine, saying that people are childish for boycotting the goods of people they dont support is like saying Sarah Brady is childish becuase she doesnt by NRA t-shirts. The point is, why support someone you don't agree with? If I dont support a guy running for office and dont vote for him is that being childish?

I could be very 3rd Gradish on this issue.. 
 Lets say.. They said something I don't like, So I'm gonna give them the silent treatment and not buy their CDs.. 
 
 Yes... They could of been practicing their freedom of speech, but they should of done that in America.. not in Europe. I wonder if the people in Europe even know what or where Texas is..
 I do not listen to the Dixie Chicks, never did and never will. I also don't ever buy cds. (mmm.. Kazaa). But, lets say that one of my favorite bands said that instead of the Dixie CHicks.. would I get my boxers bunched up because of it? Eh.. not really. Would I stop listening to them? Nope... It just depends really on what kind of person you are talking about and how mature they are.
 
 I do not agree with a lot of people, lets take the Pope for example. I do not believe in Christianity. That is something I do not AGREE with him with. But what the Pope practices, (peace, etc.) is good. So I support him.

I actually agree with the Dixie Chicks George Bush is not something to be happy or proud about. I don't think that he should be our president, we need someone we can trust with our country. Not someone who looks for weapons and retaliates because he can't find the damn weapons. The Dixie Chicks are just telling the truth thats all thats to it.
 
 
 WE NEED A NEW PRES.

I think that the Dixie Chics have the right to exercise their right to free speech, but that people also have the right to choose not to purchase their music because of what they said.
 
 Personally, I have never bought anything from the dixie chics and I have never cared for their music, but even if I liked them and they spoke against something I believe in, I wouldn't stop purchasing their music just for that.

If you want to hate the Dixie Chicks for speaking against Bush, why dont you just hate the MAJORITY of music artists as well? Dixie Chicks have constitutional rights just like you do. Your saying that anyone who doesn't like your ******* GOP president should suffer? You are a XXXXX period, end of story.

most famous ppl were totally against the war. no one said anything about them. but then the dixie chics say something in England and all of a sudden ppl are having cd burnings outside radio station buildings. post_info.post_title: The problem is not what they said...

They can say what they want, but their audience tends to be patriotic... and when they're out bashing the president, no one wants to hear them. They did it just to pander to their crowd.

And what of the African Americans who boycotted public transportation because of how they felt, were they also childish, I dont think so. How is boycotting good for some people but makes others look childish?

Why even single the Dixie Chicks out for vilification? Are they the only celebs who spoke up?
 
 Many of the famous use their celebrity, from promoting themselves, a product (including themselves) and a cause (including themselves)
